justifiable-homicide.title: Justifiable Homicide - A Political Thriller | By Robert W. McGee
justifiable-homicide.description: A group of Miami patriots decides the time has come to start killing certain politicians and others who are destroying the fabric of America. The problem is, they can't agree who should be on the list and what criteria they should use to decide who needs to be killed. When a local accounting professor learns that one of his friends is on the list he decides he must stop them at any cost.
justifiable-homicide.heading: Justifiable Homicide
justifiable-homicide.label: Story
justifiable-homicide.intro_one: When does the killing of political leaders become morally justifiable? Killing the Hitlers, Stalins and Pol Pots of the world is easy to justify. Murderous tyrants need to be killed. There is a moral duty to present and future generations to kill them. But what if our leaders are merely idiots, or perhaps corrupt, petty tyrants who are not in the same league as Hitler, Stalin or Pol Pot? How much damage can we allow them to do, how many of our rights can we allow them to take away, before killing them becomes justifiable homicide?
justifiable-homicide.intro_two: In Justifiable Homicide - A Political Thriller a small group of patriots believes that some of our leaders have already crossed the line and decide to do something about it. They identify potential targets for assassination and start going through the list.
justifiable-homicide.intro_three: When Robert Paige, a Miami-based accounting professor with some firearms and martial arts training, learns that one of his friends is on the list, he decides that he must do whatever is necessary to stop them. The problem is that he does not know who all the cell members are or how to stop them.

annie-and-the-senator.title: Annie and the Senator | By Robert W. McGee
annie-and-the-senator.description: Annie and the Senator, by Robert W McGee. Annie Chan rises from the streets of Bangkok to become a top executive in America…until a Senator gets in her way.
annie-and-the-senator.heading: Annie and the Senator
annie-and-the-senator.label: Synopsis
annie-and-the-senator.intro_one: Annie Chan. Half Chinese, half Thai. Daughter of a Bangkok pole dancer. Her beauty and other talents catapulted her into the world of high-priced Hong Kong escorts. Her life changed when her millionaire lover sent her to America to get an education.
annie-and-the-senator.intro_two: A few years later she emerged from Harvard with an MBA and CPA. With a little help from her friend she rose to the position of president at one of the largest banks in Miami.
annie-and-the-senator.intro_three: Her career was going along well until a certain senator started causing problems for her. When he threatened to expose her past and destroy her career, she decided she had to silence him. The problem is, she didn’t know how to do it. Not right away, that is.

just-following-orders.title: Just Following Orders | By Robert W. McGee
just-following-orders.heading: Just Following Orders
just-following-orders.label: Synopsis
just-following-orders.intro_one: The second volume in the Trilogy – Just Following Orders – places readers in the mind of one of the soldiers who is ordered to participate in Massouma’s abuse.
just-following-orders.intro_two: Although he is disgusted by what his lieutenant orders his men to do, and while he seriously considers killing the lieutenant to stop the abuse going on before his eyes, he obeys, because he has been taught not to question orders.
just-following-orders.intro_three: This volume highlights the disgusting practice of female genital mutilation in a graphic way, challenges the morality of enhanced interrogation, and questions the view that there is a duty to obey all orders. This novelette sets the stage for volume 3 of the Trilogy.

the-iraqi-girl.title: The Iraqi Girl | By Robert W. McGee
the-iraqi-girl.heading: The Iraqi Girl
the-iraqi-girl.label: Synopsis
the-iraqi-girl.intro_one: The Iraqi Girl, volume one of The Iraqi Girl Trilogy, introduces readers to Massouma Qassim Ibrahim, who is sexually abused by U.S. soldiers at the age of five.
the-iraqi-girl.intro_two: This volume questions the morality of enhanced interrogation, highlights the disgusting practice of female genital mutilation in a graphic way.
the-iraqi-girl.intro_three: It sets the stage for revenge and the vigilante justice that are to follow in volumes 2 and 3 of The Iraqi Girl Trilogy.

tsa-vs-the-people.title: The TSA vs the People | By Robert W. McGee
tsa-vs-the-people.description: The TSA vs. the People, by Robert W McGee. The TSA and its Gestapo tactics ruin James Young’s life. He decides to ruin some of their lives.
tsa-vs-the-people.heading: The TSA vs the People
tsa-vs-the-people.label: Synopsis
tsa-vs-the-people.intro_one: What would YOU do if the TSA sexually assaulted YOUR mother? If you’re a red-blooded American, you’d do the same thing James Young did. What did James Young do? You’ll have to read the story.
tsa-vs-the-people.intro_two: This book really highlights the effects that governmental abuse of power and paranoia can do to individual lives. In this short novel James Young decides that he has had enough and decides to do something about it.
tsa-vs-the-people.intro_three: The legal system has failed him. The solution is vigilante justice.
